sorcer.tools.webster

Class Webster

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.tools.webster.Webster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class Webster
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Webster is a HTTP server which can serve code from multiple codebases. Environment variables used to control Webster are as follows:
    sorcer.tools.webster.port Sets the port for webster to use 0
    sorcer.tools.webster.root Root directory to serve code from. Webster supports multiple root directories which are separated by a ; System.getProperty(user.home)
    Author:
    Dennis Reedy and Mike Sobolewski

    • Constructor Detail

      • Webster

        public Webster()
        throws BindException
        Create a new Webster. The port is determined by the webster.port system property. If the webster.port system property does not exist, an anonymous port will be allocated.
        Throws:
        BindException - if Webster cannot create a socket

        Throws:

        public Webster(int port,
       String roots,
       String bindAddress,
       boolean isDaemon)
        throws BindException
        Create a new Webster
        Parameters:
        port - The port to use
        roots - The root(s) to serve code from. This is a semi-colin delimited list of directories
        bindAddress - TCP/IP address which Webster should bind to (null implies no specific address)
        Throws:
        BindException - if Webster cannot create a socket

      • Webster

        public Webster(int port,
       String roots,
       String bindAddress,
       int minThreads,
       int maxThreads,
       boolean isDaemon)
        throws BindException
        Create a new Webster
        Parameters:
        port - The port to use
        roots - The root(s) to serve code from. This is a semi-colin delimited list of directories
        bindAddress - TCP/IP address which Webster should bind to (null implies no specific address)
        minThreads - Minimum threads to use in the ThreadPool
        maxThreads - Minimum threads to use in the ThreadPool
        Throws:
        BindException - if Webster cannot create a socket

      • Webster

        public Webster(int port,
       String roots,
       String bindAddress,
       int minThreads,
       int maxThreads,
       int startPort,
       int endPort,
       boolean isDaemon)
        throws BindException
        Create a new Webster
        Parameters:
        port - The port to use
        roots - The root(s) to serve code from. This is a semi-colin delimited list of directories
        bindAddress - TCP/IP address which Webster should bind to (null implies no specific address)
        minThreads - Minimum threads to use in the ThreadPool
        maxThreads - Minimum threads to use in the ThreadPool
        startPort - First port to try to listen
        endPort - Last port to try to listen
        Throws:
        BindException - if Webster cannot create a socket

      • Webster

        public Webster(String[] args,
       LifeCycle lifeCycle)
        throws Exception
        Create a new Webster, compatible with the ServiceStarter mechanism in Jini 2.0
        Parameters:
        args - String[] of options. Valid options are [-port port], [-roots list-of-roots], [-bindAddress address], [-minThreads minThreads], [-maxThreads maxThreads] [-soTimeout soTimeout]
        lifeCycle - The LifeCycle object, may be null
        Throws:
        BindException - if Webster cannot create a socket
        Exception

        public String getAddress()
        Get address that Webster is bound to
        Returns:
